Overview  Package  Class   Use  Tree  Deprecated  Index  Help 
 PREV   NEXT FRAMES    NO FRAMES    

Uses of Package
com.appglu

Packages that use com.appglu
com.appglu The main package of AppGlu's Java Client SDK.
Contain interfaces to describe all available operations and APIs as well as model objects to be used by these operations. 
com.appglu.android The main package of AppGlu's Android SDK.
Contains the SDK's main class AppGlu and some utility classes to provide asynchronous execution using AsyncTask. 
com.appglu.android.analytics Contains the Analytics API implementation for Android.
This includes a service, a SQLite repository and the AnalyticsDispatcher abstraction and implementation. 
com.appglu.android.push Contains the Push API implementation for Android.
The Push API is used to register / unregister the device making it eligible to receive push notifications.
 
com.appglu.android.storage Contains the Storage API implementation for Android.
The Storage API has methods to download and cache files from AppGlu server.
 
com.appglu.android.sync Contains the Sync API implementation for Android.
The Sync API is used to synchronize the data in your local SQLite tables with the AppGlu server.
 
com.appglu.android.task   
com.appglu.impl Contain the implementation of interfaces and private objects only to be used internally. 
com.appglu.impl.json Support classes used for JSON parsing. 
com.appglu.impl.json.jackson Support classes used for configuring Jackson's JSON parsing library. 
 

Classes in com.appglu used by com.appglu
AnalyticsOperations
          AnalyticsOperations is used to upload events to AppGlu allowing it to collect mobile app usage statistics.
AnalyticsSession
          Represents a session of application usage.
AnalyticsSessionEvent
          Represents an event that happened during the usage of the app.
AppGluHttpClientException
          Happens when an HTTP status error of the client series is received (anything between 400 and 499).
AppGluHttpServerException
          Happens when an HTTP status error of the server series is received (anything between 500 and 599).
AppGluHttpStatusCodeException
          Happens when an HTTP status error of the client or server series is received (anything between 400-499 or 500-599).
AppGluRestClientException
          The base exception for any exception that can be thrown by the Java AppGlu client.
AsyncAnalyticsOperations
          AsyncAnalyticsOperations has all methods that AnalyticsOperations has but they execute asynchronously.
AsyncCallback
          Define methods to be called as a callback while doing an asynchronous operation.
AsyncCallback is used in every asynchronous method of the SDK.
AsyncCrudOperations
          AsyncCrudOperations has all methods that CrudOperations has but they execute asynchronously.
AsyncPushOperations
          AsyncPushOperations has all methods that PushOperations has but they execute asynchronously.
AsyncSavedQueriesOperations
          AsyncSavedQueriesOperations has all methods that SavedQueriesOperations has but they execute asynchronously.
AsyncStorageOperations
          AsyncStorageOperations has all methods that StorageOperations has but they execute asynchronously.
AsyncSyncOperations
          AsyncSyncOperations has all methods that SyncOperations has but they execute asynchronously.
AsyncUserOperations
          AsyncUserOperations has all methods that UserOperations has but they execute asynchronously.
AuthenticationResult
          Contains the result of a mobile application user sign up or log in.
If succeed is false then error will be not null.
CrudOperations
          CrudOperations contains create, read, update and delete operations to be applied on your tables.
Device
          Represents a unique device installation for the purpose of receiving push notifications.
DevicePlatform
          Represents the operating system of the device.
Error
          An Error object has a code and a message.
ErrorCode
          A code identifying the error the server has returned.
ExceptionWrapper
          If an asynchronous method throws an exception, that exception is wrapped with ExceptionWrapper to provide a easy way of extracting error code and error messages.
InputStreamCallback
          A callback to have direct access over the InputStream.
Usually used when downloading a large file or JSON.
PushOperations
          PushOperations is used to register / unregister the device making it eligible to receive push notifications.
QueryParams
          Represents the names and values of parameters to be replaced before a query is executed.
QueryResult
          Represents the result of a executed query.
A select query will return a list of rows, use QueryResult.getRows() to get it.
A insert, update or delete query will return the quantity of rows affected, use QueryResult.getRowsAffected() to get it.
ReadAllFilterArguments
          Used to specify filters to be applied when retrieving rows from the server.
Row
          Represents a row in the database.
RowChanges
          RowChanges contains the SyncOperation to be applied for this Row.
If the operation is SyncOperation.INSERT or SyncOperation.UPDATE then RowChanges.getRow() will contain the data to be used for that insert or update.
RowMapper
          Maps a Row of the database to another object.
RowMapperException
          Exception that can happen when mapping a Row object using a implementation of RowMapper.
Rows
          Contains a list of Row objects and the total number of rows that table has.
SavedQueriesOperations
          SavedQueriesOperations allow you to run your previously created SQLs on AppGlu and obtain the results.
SortDirection
          The sort direction can be SortDirection.ASC or SortDirection.DESC.
StorageFile
          Represents a file.
StorageOperations
          StorageOperations has methods to download and cache files from AppGlu server.
SyncOperation
          Represents the operation that will be executed on a single row of the SQLite database while synchronizing data.
SyncOperations
          SyncOperations is used to synchronize the data in your local SQLite tables with the AppGlu server.
TableChanges
          Contains all the delta changes of a particular table.
TableChangesCallback
          This callback will receive events while a JSON input stream is being parsed.
This JSON is the response of the Sync Changes API, containing all rows changed since the last time sync executed.
TableVersion
          A table and it's version.
User
          Represents a mobile application user.
When the User is authenticated, this object will be saved using a UserSessionPersistence implementation.
UserOperations
          UserOperations has methods to login / logout and sign up new mobile app users.
UserOperations depends on a implementation of UserSessionPersistence to keep track of the current logged in User.
UserSessionPersistenceException
          Happens when there is a problem saving or retrieving the User from a UserSessionPersistence implementation.
 

Classes in com.appglu used by com.appglu.android
AppGluRestClientException
          The base exception for any exception that can be thrown by the Java AppGlu client.
AsyncCallback
          Define methods to be called as a callback while doing an asynchronous operation.
AsyncCallback is used in every asynchronous method of the SDK.
AsyncCrudOperations
          AsyncCrudOperations has all methods that CrudOperations has but they execute asynchronously.
AsyncSavedQueriesOperations
          AsyncSavedQueriesOperations has all methods that SavedQueriesOperations has but they execute asynchronously.
AsyncUserOperations
          AsyncUserOperations has all methods that UserOperations has but they execute asynchronously.
AuthenticationResult
          Contains the result of a mobile application user sign up or log in.
If succeed is false then error will be not null.
CrudOperations
          CrudOperations contains create, read, update and delete operations to be applied on your tables.
QueryParams
          Represents the names and values of parameters to be replaced before a query is executed.
QueryResult
          Represents the result of a executed query.
A select query will return a list of rows, use QueryResult.getRows() to get it.
A insert, update or delete query will return the quantity of rows affected, use QueryResult.getRowsAffected() to get it.
ReadAllFilterArguments
          Used to specify filters to be applied when retrieving rows from the server.
Row
          Represents a row in the database.
Rows
          Contains a list of Row objects and the total number of rows that table has.
SavedQueriesOperations
          SavedQueriesOperations allow you to run your previously created SQLs on AppGlu and obtain the results.
User
          Represents a mobile application user.
When the User is authenticated, this object will be saved using a UserSessionPersistence implementation.
UserOperations
          UserOperations has methods to login / logout and sign up new mobile app users.
UserOperations depends on a implementation of UserSessionPersistence to keep track of the current logged in User.
UserSessionPersistence
          Strategy for keeping track of the authenticated mobile application User.
When UserOperations.signup(User) or UserOperations.login(String, String) are called the User will be saved using UserSessionPersistence.saveAuthenticatedUser(User).
When UserOperations.logout() is called then the User will be removed using UserSessionPersistence.logout().
UserSessionPersistenceException
          Happens when there is a problem saving or retrieving the User from a UserSessionPersistence implementation.
